fields.summary: Auto scaling unable to create launch configuration in HA setup

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Auto scaling background tasks run on both cloud controllers in HA setup

comments.body: [~sjones], what's the fix?  surgical/simple?  This is a serious issue.

For 3.3 the background activity issue could be addressed by checking for an enabled Eucalytpus component, but I think there will also be other issues with service requests not being directed to the correct host. [~decker] would know if there is a quick / correct fix for this.
Background tasks for Auto Scaling, CloudWatch and ELB now only run on the cloud controller with the enabled Eucalyptus service.

I just upgraded my cloud to the latest build and am still seeing the trinity services in the ENABLED state when they shouldnt be:
{code}

{code}

It is expected that the services are still enabled, the background tasks were updated to take that into account.

Not sure what the cause of the ELB error is. [~viglesias] does this occur when sending messages to the ELB service?

[~sjones]

It appears to be periodic. Although there is in fact a ELB up and running ATM, I see the message regardless of sending a message to the service.

I got a single  Loadbalancer Activity Error in the secondary CLC log after failover then the CLC was brought back up (yet the newly minted primary CLC still master).

Steps:
# When system was at ease created a load balancer
# caused a failover
# Verified the ELB servo vm was in tact on new primary CLC
# after about 10 minutes brought the old CLC back up and got one Loadbalancer Activity Error.

{code}
2013-05-30 20:16:26 ERROR | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareException: Can not find policy euca-internal-loadbalancer-vm-policy
2013-05-30 20:16:26  INFO | Can not find policy euca-internal-loadbalancer-vm-policy
2013-05-30 20:16:26  INFO | Failed to send message GetRolePolicyType to service EuareInternal because: Can not find policy euca-internal-loadbalancer-vm-policy
2013-05-30 20:16:26 ERROR | Loadbalancer activity error
2013-05-30 20:16:35  INFO | Triggering caching: loadbalancer_v1/eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-devel-1.0.0-79.130530gitaddfeb9.img.manifest.xml
2013-05-30 20:16:35  INFO | Image found in cache: loadbalancer_v1/eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-devel-1.0.0-79.130530gitaddfeb9.img.manifest.xml
2013-05-30 20:16:35  INFO | Triggering caching: loadbalancer_v1/vmlinuz-2.6.32-358.6.2.el6.x86_64.manifest.xml
2013-05-30 20:16:35  INFO | Image found in cache: loadbalancer_v1/vmlinuz-2.6.32-358.6.2.el6.x86_64.manifest.xml
2013-05-30 20:16:35  INFO | Triggering caching: loadbalancer_v1/initramfs-2.6.32-358.6.2.el6.x86_64.img.manifest.xml
2013-05-30 20:16:35  INFO | Image found in cache: loadbalancer_v1/initramfs-2.6.32-358.6.2.el6.x86_64.img.manifest.xml
2013-05-30 20:16:35  INFO | Found authorized clusters: [CC_45]
2013-05-30 20:16:35  INFO | Availability: CC_45 -> 6
{code}

Tony, do you continue to see the error? Elb should have deleted the as
group for servo vm so eventually the servo vm should be terminated and
not send the request..

[~spark] that error appears to have stopped (at least it's not in the current roll of cloud-output.log)

Status: 
With non-euca/non-admin user I've had a LB with some instances registered and deregistered sprinkled in with fail overs all the while running apache bench load and have not had anything truly bad happen (just the above mentioned log messages) that subside and do not happen with each failover.  Also have an autoscaling group I keep changing capacity up and down for along for the ride. Have not noticed any log messages related to scaling issues. Metrics are being collected throughout.
Approved as release pending per management team review.  Please reopen if there is an issue
